sentences.english: The din in the factory ends abruptly when the noon whistle sounds.
sentences.chinese: 当中午的笛声响起时，工厂里的嘈杂声顿时停止了。

sentences.english: I was confused by all the noise.
sentences.chinese: 一片嘈杂声把我弄得昏头昏脑。

sentences.english: Some people ran into the road. They get Listend a loud noise.
sentences.chinese: 有些人跑上了街，她们听到很响的嘈杂声。

sentences.english: Suddenly, amid the noise, the chairman of the meeting brought the proceedings to a close.
sentences.chinese: 在一片嘈杂声中，会议主席突然结束了会议议项。

sentences.english: They began to hum when seeing Jackson walk into the hall.
sentences.chinese: 他们一看到杰克逊走进大厅，开始发出了嘈杂声。

sentences.english: Some people ran into the street. They had heard a loud noise.
sentences.chinese: 有些人跑上了街，他们听到很响的嘈杂声。

sentences.english: The noises sounded in the hall.
His ears are attuned to the noise of a big city.
sentences.chinese: 他已经听惯大城市的嘈杂声了。

sentences.english: The confused sounds of the banquet reached his ear.
sentences.chinese: 酒席上的嘈杂声传到了他耳边。

sentences.english: There was the usual clanging and industriousness on the construction sites.
sentences.chinese: 建筑嘈杂声和忙碌景象一如既往。

sentences.english: The noise of traffic lept him awake.
sentences.chinese: 车辆的嘈杂声使我怎么也睡不着。

sentences.english: eg: This noise is interfering with my work.
sentences.chinese: 这嘈杂声妨碍我的工作。

sentences.english: The street noisiness makes me reading without concentration.
sentences.chinese: 街上的嘈杂声使我不能专心读书。

sentences.english: This afternoon when I was sleeping, I was woken up by a noise from the living room.
sentences.chinese: 今天下午我在睡觉时被客厅的嘈杂声吵醒。

sentences.english: I can't endure that noise any longer.
sentences.chinese: 我再也忍受不了那嘈杂声。

definition: small craftsman (contemptuous)/clatter (e.g. of footsteps)/jumbled mass/press of bodies/tumult
noisy and in disarray/in an uproar
